text.section: In this section, "highway work zone" means a construction or maintenance area on or alongside a highway that is marked by appropriate warning signs or other traffic control devices designating that work is in progress.

section.section: The State Highway Administration may reduce established speed limits in a highway work zone upon a determination that the change is necessary to ensure the public safety.

A county may:
Designate an area on a county highway or a highway on which the county is authorized to do work pursuant to a maintenance agreement as a highway work zone; and
Reduce established speed limits in the highway work zone after a determination that the change is necessary to ensure the public safety.

A municipal corporation may:
Designate an area on a municipal highway or a highway on which the municipal corporation is authorized to do work pursuant to a maintenance agreement as a highway work zone; and
Reduce established speed limits in the highway work zone after a determination that the change is necessary to ensure the public safety.

text.section: A speed limit established under this section shall become effective when posted.
